required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigational Study of Experimental Medication BMS-986165 in Participants With Moderate to Severe Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of the Safety and Efficacy of BMS-986165 in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and effectiveness of BMS-986165 compared to placebo in participants with moderately to severely active Crohn's Disease.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants achieving clinical remission at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission defined by Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants achieving endoscopic response at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Endoscopic response defined by Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease (SES-CD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants who achieve a clinical response at Week 12
Proportion of participants who achieve PRO2 [Participant reported outcome based on the stool frequency and abdominal pain components of the Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)] remission at Week 12
Change from baseline in SES-CD (Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease) at Week 12
Proportion of participants achieving endoscopic normalization at Week 12
Proportion of participants achieving endoscopic remission at Week 12
Proportion of participants achieving deep remission at Week 12

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented diagnosis of Crohn's Disease (CD) of at least 3 months' duration, including ileal, colonic, or ileo-colonic disease distribution
- Must have active moderate to severe CD
- Men and women must agree to follow specific methods of contraception, if applicable
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe or fulminant colitis that is likely to require surgery or hospitalization
- Presence of a diagnosis of alternative forms of colitis (infectious, inflammatory including ulcerative colitis, malignant, toxic, indeterminate, etc.) other than Crohn's Disease
- Previous exposure to BMS-986165 in any study
- Any major illness/condition or evidence of an unstable clinical condition (eg, renal, hepatic, hematologic, gastrointestinal, endocrine, pulmonary, immunologic, psychiatric, or local active infection/infectious illness) that, in the investigator's judgment, will substantially increase the risk to the participant
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria apply
